Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'Goût de Beurre Comme au Cinéma' is clearly descriptive or deceptively misdescriptive
Procedural_Stage: Appeal under s. 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Consumer surveys deemed unreliable as they focused on packaging, not the trademark itself
Burden_of_Proof: On opponent (Dairy Farmers of Canada) to show non-registrability
Legal_Rule: Trademarks must not be clearly descriptive or deceptively misdescriptive of goods
Procedural_Issue: Appropriateness of evidence in trademark examination process
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-registrability under subsection 38(2) of the Trade-marks Act
Outcome_on_Merits: Trademark found registrable as not clearly or deceptively descriptive
Decision_Maker: Registrar of Trademarks, upheld by Court
Key_Evidence_Considered: Trademark as a whole, including 'comme au cinéma'; consumer survey data
Applicant_Challenge: Hunt-Wesson's application opposed by Dairy Farmers of Canada
Court_Result: Upheld Registrar's decision, dismissed appeal, awarded costs to respondent
Defendant_Response: Hunt-Wesson defended registrability of the mark
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative opposition followed by judicial appeal
Claimant_Status: Dairy Farmers of Canada as opponent
Applicable_Process: Section 56 appeal process under the Trade-marks Act
